plants.name: Helianthus annuus
plants.description: Sunflowers are tall annual plants known for their large, bright yellow flower heads that track the sun across the sky. They thrive in full sun and are widely cultivated for their seeds and oil.
plants.location: Temperate regions of North America, Europe, and Asia
plants.funFact: Sunflowers can grow up to 3 meters tall and their flower heads can contain up to 2,000 individual flowers called florets.

plants.name: Rosa spp.
plants.description: Roses are woody perennial flowering plants well known for their fragrant and visually diverse flowers, often cultivated in gardens worldwide. Many rose species and cultivars bloom repeatedly through the summer months.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to early autumn, including August
plants.funFact: Rose hips, the fruit of the rose plant, are rich in vitamin C and have been used in herbal remedies.

plants.name: Dahlia pinnata
plants.description: Dahlias are tuberous perennial plants known for their striking, multi-petaled flowers in a variety of shapes and vibrant colors. They bloom abundantly in late summer and early autumn.
plants.location: Native to Mexico and Central America, widely cultivated globally
plants.funFact: Dahlias were declared the national flower of Mexico in 1963.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: Lupines are tall, erect flowering plants with spikes covered in densely packed pea-like flowers. They bloom profusely in summer and are popular in wildflower meadows and gardens.
plants.location: Native to North America and Europe, commonly found in temperate zones
plants.funFact: Lupines enrich soil by fixing nitrogen, which benefits other plants around them.
